params.name: format
params.description: File format in which to save graph. `format=flash` has been deprecated in CF2016+

params.name: chartheight
params.description: Chart height; integer number of pixels

params.name: chartwidth
params.description: Chart width; integer number of pixels

params.name: scalefrom
params.description: Y-axis minimum value; integer

params.name: scaleto
params.description: Y-axis max value; integer

params.name: showxgridlines
params.description: yes: display X-axis gridlines

params.name: showygridlines
params.description: yes: display Y-axis gridlines

params.name: gridlines
params.description:
Number of grid lines to display on value axis, including
 axis; positive integer.

params.name: seriesplacement
params.description:
Applies to charts that have more than one data series.
 Relative positions of series.

params.name: foregroundcolor
params.description:
color for control. For a hex value, use the form:
 textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash
 signs or none.

params.name: backgroundcolor
params.description:
Color of the area between the data background and the chart
 border, around labels and around the legend. Hexadecimal
 value or supported named color. For a hex value, use the form:
 textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash
 signs or none.

params.name: showborder
params.description: Whether to display a border around the chart

params.name: databackgroundcolor
params.description:
color for control. For a hex value, use the form:
 textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash
 signs or none.

params.name: font
params.description: Font of data in column.

params.name: fontsize
params.description: Size of text in column.

params.name: fontitalic
params.description: Yes: displays grid control text in italics

params.name: fontbold
params.description: Yes: displays grid control text in bold

params.name: labelformat
params.description: Format for Y-axis labels.

params.name: xaxistitle
params.description: text; X-axis title

params.name: yaxistitle
params.description: text; X-axis title

params.name: xaxistype
params.description:
CF6.1+ The axis indicates the data category. Data is sorted according to the sortXAxis attribute.
 * scale The axis is numeric. All cfchartdata item attribute
 values must numeric. The X axis is automatically sorted
 numerically.

params.name: yaxistype
params.description:
CF6.1+ Currently has no effect, as Y axis is always used for data
 values. Valid values are category and scale

params.name: sortxaxis
params.description:
Display column labels in alphabetic order along X-axis.
 Ignored if the xAxisType attribute is scale.

params.name: show3d
params.description: Display chart with three-dimensional appearance.

params.name: xoffset
params.description:
Applies if show3D="yes". Number of units by which to
 display the chart as angled, horizontally

params.name: yoffset
params.description:
Applies if show3D="yes". Number of units by which to
 display the chart as angled, horizontally.

params.name: showlegend
params.description: CF8+ if chart contains more than one data series, display legend

params.name: tipstyle
params.description:
Determines the action that opens a popup window to display
 information about the current chart element.
 * mouseDown: display if the user positions the cursor at the element
 and clicks the mouse. Applies only to Flash format graph files.
 * mouseOver: displays if the user positions the cursor at the element
 * none: suppresses display

params.name: tipbgcolor
params.description:
color for control. For a hex value, use the form:
 textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash
 signs or none.

params.name: showmarkers
params.description:
Applies to chartseries type attribute values line, curve
 and scatter.
 yes: display markers at data points

params.name: markersize
params.description: Size of data point marker. in pixels. Integer.

params.name: pieslicestyle
params.description: Applies to chartseries type attribute value pie.

params.name: URL
params.description:
URL to open if the user clicks item in a data series; the
 onClick destination page.

 You can specify variables within the URL string;
 ColdFusion passes current values of the variables.
 * $VALUE$: the value of the selected row. If none, the value is an empty string.
 * $ITEMLABEL$: the label of the selected item. If none, the value is an empty string.
 * $SERIESLABEL$: the label of the selected series. If none, the value is an empty string.

params.name: name
params.description:
Page variable name. String. Generates the the graph as
 binary data and assigns it to the specified variable.
 Suppresses chart display. You can use the name value in
 the cffile tag to write the chart to a file.

params.name: style
params.description: CF7+ XML file or string to use to specify the style of the chart.

params.name: title
params.description: CF7+ Title of the chart.

examples.title: CFML Markup
examples.description: A Simple PIE chart with hard coded data.
examples.code:
<cfchart format="html" title="Sales Report">
	<cfchartseries type="pie">
		<cfchartdata item="2012" value="#RandRange(300000,900000)#">
		<cfchartdata item="2013" value="#RandRange(300000,900000)#">
		<cfchartdata item="2014" value="#RandRange(300000,900000)#">
		<cfchartdata item="2015" value="#RandRange(300000,900000)#">
	</cfchartseries>
</cfchart>
